Course Description: THIS COURSE GIVES STUDENTS OPPORTUNITY TO UNDERSTAND THE RELATIONSHIP OF THEORY TO PRACTICE THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN A SERVICE-LEARNING EXPERIENCE.  STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE 20 HOURS OF VOLUNTEER WORK, A SERVICE-LEARNING CONTRACT, AND AN ORAL AND WRITTEN REFLECTION OF THE EXPERIENCE.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1. ANALYZE CONCEPT OF SERVICE-LEARNING (LECTURE 0.5 HOUR)
DOMAIN COGNITIVE LEVEL ANALYZING
LINKED CORE ABILITY: MODEL ETHIC AND CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY
1.A. EXAMINE THE SERVICE-LEARNING CONCEPT
1.B. IDENTIFY POSSIBLE SERVICE-LEARNING SITES
1.C. SELECT SERVICE-LEARNING SITE APPROPRIATE FOR BOTH STUDENT AND CLASS 

2. FORMULATE MEASURABLE SERVICE-LEARNING GOALS (LECTURE 0.5 HOUR)
DOMAIN COGNITIVE LEVEL CREATING
LINKED CORE ABILITY: MODEL ETHIC AND CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY
2.A. DOCUMENT LIST OF GOALS FOR SERVICE-LEARNING EXPERIENCE
2.B. CREATE TIMELINE FOR SERVICE-LEARNING EXPERIENCE
2.C. COMPLETE MANDATORY REFLECTION SEMINAR

3. SYNTHESIZE FIELD EXPERIENCE COMPONENT AND CLASSROOM LEARNING (LECTURE 1 HOUR)
AFFECTIVE DOMAIN
LINKED CORE ABILITY: MODEL ETHIC AND CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY
3.A. DEMONSTRATE INTERRELATEDNESS OF VOLUNTEER/SERVICE-LEARNING COMPONENT WITH COURSE CONCEPTS
3.B. DISCUSS CONNECTIVITY BETWEEN VOLUNTEER/SERVICE-LEARNING COMPONENT AND SOCIAL SCIENCE
3.C. GENERATE DISCUSSION WITH CLASSMATES REGARDING SERVICE-LEARNING EXPERIENCE
3.D. SUMMARIZE SERVICE-LEARNING EXPERIENCE AND ITS RELATION TO CLASS 

4. INTEGRATE MEANING AND BENEFITS OF SERVICE-LEARNING FOR SELF, SERVICE, AND SOCIETY (LECTURE 1 HOUR)
DOMAIN COGNITIVE LEVEL CREATING
LINKED CORE ABILITIES: MODEL ETHIC AND CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY
4.A. DEMONSTRATE UNDERSTANDING OF MEANING OF SERVICE-LEARNING
4.B. DISCUSS BENEFITS OF SERVICE-LEARNING TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENT
4.C. SUMMARIZE BENEFITS OF SERVICE-LEARNING TO COMMUNITY
4.D. EXPLAIN BENEFITS OF SERVICE-LEARNING TO SOCIETY AS A WHOLE

5. COMPLETE NECESSARY SERVICE EXPERIENCE DOCUMENTATION (LECTURE 1 HOUR)
DOMAIN COGNITIVE LEVEL APPLYING
LINKED CORE ABILITIES: MODEL ETHIC AND CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY
5.A. COMPLETE SERVICE EXPERIENCE DOCUMENTATION FOR FACULTY
5.B. COMPLETE SERVICE EXPERIENCE DOCUMENTATION FOR CENTER FOR SERVICE-LEARNING & CIVIC ENGAGEMENT
5.C. REVIEW SERVICE EXPERIENCE SUPERVISOR'S PERFORMANCE EVALUATION(S) OF THE STUDENT 

6. ILLUSTRATE ETHICAL AND CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY IN FIELD (LAB 20 HOURS)
DOMAIN COGNITIVE LEVEL APPLYING 
LINKED CORE ABILITIES: MODEL ETHIC AND CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY
6.A. COMPLETE SERVICE-LEARNING SITE ORIENTATION (IF APPLICABLE)
6.B. WORK WITH OTHERS IN FIELD
6.C. DEMONSTRATE ETHICAL BEHAVIOR AND CONSCIENTIOUSNESS IN FIELD
6.D. COMPLETE REQUIRED NUMBER OF FIELD HOURS
